BZqWN5xlZPXBGfiueV8zsQ.text: We decided to try out a new restaurant for "taco tuesday" this week: Tres Rios. First thing to note is coming here for happy hour, or any time when southside is busy, means difficult parking. We managed to snag a spot a few blocks over, and because it was such a beautiful day out, didn't mind the walk at all.   Upon arriving, there were only a few other people. No one was at a table, and we decided to join the 'crowd' at the bar. We got two seats near an open window. The bartender greeted us immediately, handed us food and drink menus and explained the specials. On tuesdays, the entree tacos are $8, and for happy hour their house margaritas are $6.   I first ordered the Frida Kahlo. It is about $10 for a drink which was a little expensive. It was not on the happy hour menu though, and I knew that so I was OK ordering it. it was AWESOME. It was basically a pomegranate margarita, but it was perfect for a nice spring afternoon.   We opted not to order tacos, and instead ordered the Mexican Street corn and guac appetizers. The street corn was very small, only two pieces (so thankfully we each got one) but cost $7 dollars. However, it was DELICIOUS. I wish that there had been more, I could've eaten four portions of it easily!  The guac was fantastic. They advertise fresh guac. They re-fill the chips for free and you get WAY more guac here than any other place I've been too. And it's good guac, not just mashed avocado. There's more flavoring.   Tres Rios is known as a tequila bar. Unfortunately during this trip, I did not explore the tequila options, but I think next time we come here I will. The only downside to this restaurant is that it is a bit on the pricer side for Mexican food in Pittsburgh, but isn't significantly any better than other restaurants locally. People were very attentive, and everything came out quick. Just kinda expensive so customer be warned.

xDTkBFpjbtboNGeVArl4VA.text: Oh my oh my! When advertisement matches my reality and supersedes it with flavor and deliciousness!!! This is the place to go for happy hour and tacos period.  If you like low key with good eats then this is the place to be.  I had an elderflower margarita which was delicious  I also had a strawberry margarita which was amazing!   Taco Tuesday is the best time to hit this spot. My favorite one by far, and my taco of choice is the  barbacoa! The chicken and carde asada was delicious too.   Apparently the next time I go I have to try the frog legs one... I'll have to work my self up for that one but I will definitely try. Until next time ... enjoy the pictures!

9Vdwh-XtUPYXtKLscrcHuQ.text: Service was good, friendly people. Food was bland and didn't taste 'fresh'.  We ordered some drinks, lavender margherita and the mule.. Neither were very good. I had the lavender margherita and it didn't have that fresh taste you want from a marg.. tasted like a grocery store mix. The mule just tasted like tequila, nothing special about it so both drinks felt over priced.  The food looks amazing (some of it) but left alot to be desired. The made to order guac tasted and looked like it was just squeezed out of a bag. The  ultra smooth consistency seemed weird and there  wasn't much flavor. The chips were good but nothing special, from a bag. This was the maybe the worst guacamole I've ever had, nothing particularly gross about it but guac isn't hard so I expect it be really good at a Mexican style restaurant.  I ordered the Carne Asada tacos and my boyfriend ordered the Carne Yucca buritto. Neither of us liked the tacos.. I sort of ate 1 of the 3 (didn't eat all of the tortilla), my boyfriend tried the 2nd but didn't finish it completely either and the third was left to be tossed. The steak was ok but the taco as a whole was again flavorless (even with the accompanying salsa). I didn't care for the tortilla at all.  The Carne Yucca buritto was good, my boyfriend gave me half since he felt bad I didn't eat much else.  There are a decent amount of other places around with better quality tacos and drinks, since this restaurant left me craving a GOOD taco I'll be visiting one of the other places soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne asada tacos
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;made to order&#34; guacamole and lavender margherita

1TcIf10U8rEgCau573N8rw.text: First time at Tres Rios and will absolutely be going back.  Ordered Shrimp Ceviche and guacamole for appetizers.  Very pleased.  Main course, was Duck Taco's.  Wow.  Incredible flavor!  Excellent service staff too.

Aupu-xXtIsVlkYBKkCj6qw.text: We came here on cinco de Mayo because my sister was in town and she's vegetarian. This seems to be one of the only Mexican places that has vegetarian options outside of just the normal veggies. To start, we got the chips and guacamole which we quickly devoured. They give you 2 cups of guacamole so we had to ask for more chips to finish it off! It was very flavorful and had the perfect combination of ingredients. We skipped the drinks because we had to drive, but my boyfriend got a hose Marg because they were on special and I tasted it, it was great! I enjoy margaritas made with orange juice and that's how they do it. It was also strong which is nice for your money. My meal was the duck tacos. I LOVE duck and somehow I could only finish two because they were so filling. They were delicious tho! What a great combo of flavors. I also had a side of yucca fries and that sauce on the side is to die for! I had the leftovers for breakfast the next day. My boyfriend got the hot metal burrito and the  yucca on it was cooked perfectly, almost tasting like breakfast potatoes. My sister got the jackfruit quesadilla as her meal and she ate every bite. Her only complaint is you definitely will need a fork and knife! Our food was a little slow because a party of like 20 put in an order right before us, but our waiter kept our water filled and kept checking on us. I really liked this place and will go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. pato (duck) tacos... so good. The cilantro rice is great!
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jackfruit quesadilla. Mind blown!
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot metal burrito!

0OGheij9qR6n-yQ9TjhF2Q.text: My girlfriend and I went to Tres Rios for dinner and drinks on a Saturday night in August and had an awesome time! We were really surprised by how quiet it was inside the restaurant considering we arrived around 7pm for dinner... but we were also thankful to not have a wait for a table.  First, I have to say that the service was exceptional. Our waitress was one of the sweetest women that I've ever encountered in the restaurant industry. She was very attentive but not overbearing and was genuinely excited when we enjoyed components of our meal.  The champagne sangria was the specialty drink of the evening, and boy was it amazing. We both drank several and they just got better the more that we drank! They were very well balanced beverages -- not too sweet but not too tart. I suggested that we order the Yucca Bowl as I am very familiar with yucca due to my Cuban heritage. The yucca was fried beautifully, so crispy and crunchy, and the cheese and jalapeno and other various toppings paired perfectly with the fries.  For my entree, I ordered the outstanding Pork Belly Tacos. The heavy and salty pork was balanced perfectly with the light slaw and pineapple that accompanied the meat on the plate. Finally, for dessert, we got a little crazy and shared the fried ice cream topped with chocolate and caramel. No exaggeration but I could barely stand up and leave the restaurant when we were done eating because I was so, so full.  Every component of our dinner was outstanding! The only negative to Tres Rios is the location -- being in the midst of crazy south side on a weekend evening. I definitely think Tres Rios would do well opening a couple locations in other parts of town.

l3BUErfOAoxjQCIwPoyy1Q.text: Went for dinner and drinks on a Friday evening. I had the dragonfruit jalapeno margarita-so good! I love that they have a couple options for spicy margs! My sister had two different kinds of margaritas, and really liked both of them too. I ordered the chicken tacos and cilantro rice for dinner. I thought the meal was good, but have had better tacos at other places. All things considered, it was a fun place to go and I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

AB3KpE-l6boUFQSpLC64wA.text: I love the food here! The prices are great and I think the food is fresh and always served hot. I tend to get the shrimp tacos. I like to stick to what I know. The service has always been great for me. I would definitely recommend this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp tacos! Yum yum

laq25omlE0em-XirQ2PAMA.text: This is a nice little place on Carson Street. It was a lovely interior very nice build out. Food is good I had the tomato tortilla soup. I really like that. My wife at the hot metal burrito which we shared and we both liked.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dWltCSQhwS73XSgg3wCLKA.text: Friends from out of town were visiting us here in Pgh and they were told to check this restaurant out. Not really sure why.   I went with them, assuming it'd be fine. The service was quick, no complaints about the staff. But the food was extremely mediocre and overpriced.   The empanadas were sad. The dough was undercooked, not crispy or golden, soggy with grease. The side accompaniment of shredded lettuce and chopped tomato was dripping wet as though it was rinsed and not dried right before being plated. The color was really muted on the veg as well. It didn't feel fresh. The beef filling for the empanadas was like the ground beef I remember getting in grade school cafeteria tacos. The food wasn't gross or anything, it was just a huge let down, especially given the price. Two little wet empanadas for $10.  I also got the duck tacos - would never have even known they were duck if the menu had not given the distinction. They didn't taste BAD, but were slathered in a bbq sauce that covered up whatever natural flavor might have made me think I was eating duck. The texture of the meat was also a total disservice. It was shredded up so finely, I could have been eating pulled pork.   Very disappointing to all for soulless pricey food.   At least provide some free chips and salsa.

Dm4jboAUY4w89bRcNUFTxA.text: Enjoyed the Fish Tacos at Tres Rios this weekend....  They were very tasty.  Looking forward to going back to try the "Street" and Pork belly Tacos....  Staff was friendly and attentive to our needs and time-frame..  I would like to see a sample option were you can try various Tacos (i.e. Duck, Pork Belly.....).    Definitely going back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish Tacos!

FUs-ztQgysc7dUoZlwbunw.text: No complaints here! I stopped in by myself for lunch during a slow work day. The interior decor is very trendy. I started off with the empanadas and they were great. They were filled with ground beef and served on a layer of cheese sauce with some sour cream on top. Very savory. I got the pork belly tacos for my entree and these were also very good. The taco shell as you'll hear from many reviews is unique. It's like a cross between a corn and flour tortilla. Soft but crunchy on the outside. The pork belly was on point, and the sauce that came with the tacos was tasty. The black beans on the side were just like any black beans, but I really liked the cilantro rice. The rice was actually tinted green from all the cilantro used. In my opinion, you can never have too much cilantro! I would say this place leans more towards trendy, Americanized taco joint than super authentic, but the food and the environment are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork belly tacos

RbZQFyKvQEuf8mN15ydRDQ.text: I was blown away by how amazing the food and the drinks were! It was obvious that there was a good attention to detail when it came to the ingredients. From the handmade tortillas to the in house syrups and margaritas! The whole time I felt welcomed and included like I was at a family dinner! Loved the staff and definitely plan on becoming a regular! I recommend the picante Paloma and the spicy passion fruit margarita!!! Great atmosphere and good party/ celebration additude!  #3RMardiGras #goingagain #newfavorite

656N986SgTdVqfWqfydAZg.text: Absolutely the best tacos in Pittsburgh!  The tortillas are hand made so they are crispy and tender at the same time.  Everything I have tried is flavorful.  Drinks are fantastic.  Nice modern atmosphere.  My daughter and husband like it just as much.  Can get crowded on weekends so go early.

my8kGAut0yKYWA77hVMocQ.text: Yeah this place is legit.. I'm from Texas and really struggle to find good Authentic Mexican food in the Burgh.. found this place and Bam, hit the spot. I'll be a regular at this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome bar

lDJOz2X0u5ZlReG1jXLJiA.text: Ugh, just okay. An interesting spin on Mexican cuisine, just not that great. Portions are small. Up side is this place has a nice beer selection. More of an apps stop, not a meal.

PoXGPEphVLF19L7l95O9yQ.text: I had high hopes for this place, but after eating there I wouldn't go back.  The food has way too much sauce on it.  The fajitas we got were practically sitting in a soup when they came out.

Yr4LNZVGXh9NviLvavGUFw.text: I was skeptical of this place knowing that the owners are part of the Emiliano's family. My last few experiences at Emiliano's were not the best. However, I went in with an open mind and I am so glad I did! It was a Sunday and I was with 5 other guests. We perched up at the bar and browsed their drink menu. The special of the day was the roasted red pepper marg and while that sounds iffy, I was intrigued and gave it a shot. The rest of our group got the pear marg, spicy passionfruit and pittsburgh des sol. Roasted red pepper for the win!! Not too sweet but not bitter, just the right balance so it did not taste like a blended pepper over ice. We ordered fresh gauc and the nachos.  The Gauc was tasty but it was hard to tell if it was fresh made in the kitchen or prepped earlier in the day. Meh. The chips were warm and delicate but stiff enough to scoop the gauc. The nachos portion was smaller than expected and the ratio of toppings to chips was off it's game. The triple meat topping was scooped on top when it should have been spread throughout the chips. The flavor was a bit bland so most of our group picked out the chips with cheese and just ate those. A side of salsa would have gone a long way with the nachos. We decided we would not order the nachos again.  Our bartender was very attentive, knowledgeable and kind. She made for a great experience. Along with that and the drinks, I will be back next time I am in the 'Burgh and I'll explore more of their menu :)

9SIXB2E2caNTWYBXF1hMaQ.text: This restaurant absolutely was fantastic in every way! I have a couple mexican restaurants that I go to in my hometown, but this place made those seem American. Everything was homemade. My boyfriend and I went and he ordered the fish tacos and I had the steak fajitas. The tortillas were homemade, homemade salsas, chips, pico de gallo, and everything just tasted very fresh. Highly recommend checking this place out, I will be back again, very soon!!

Z2uLrDYQtI6-cAyQshS2Sg.text: The food was pretty good and very artfully served. Our only complaint, and all three of us noticed it, was how greasy the food was. I ordered the beet tacos with goat cheese (and a nice mix of slaw and other toppings) and they were delicious, but the tortillas were recently dipped in grease and warmed. Totally unnecessary! My niece had the yucca fries and they were oily, even for fries! If they could learn to drain and blot they would easily warrant 4-5 stars.

VzCH5-HSh0rEnVZPhc81sA.text: My wife and I went here for dinner and Friday and it was fairly disappointing. First off the interior is pretty nice and well put together. We sat at the bar and got a few drinks. The margaritas weren't very good. We then had guacamole which was pretty good. I got the shrimp fajitas and it was pretty bland. I wouldn't get that again. She ordered the beet tacos and she hated them. The bill was also very big. I don't really see us going back for any reason. There were a few good things about this lave but not enough to go again. It was disappointing.

GmnqJtrGV2eLbHxO--6aUA.text: This is a prime location to either eat or drink and watch a sports game on tv. We ate at the bar during a recent penguins game and it was great. The guacamole is spicy and has a citrus twist that I did not expect. It's a great spot in the heart of southside that isn't crowded with drunk college kids.

EvgN9kew57wSZT0dYoHBsw.text: Meh...This place needs work, but it is still new, so I will give them a chance.  We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was nearly dead.  We were seated at a booth directly against the one other party of 4 eating here that day, so being able to listen to their conversation took the place of the lack of music playing.  It was bright and while there was music playing at one point, it stopped completely and the only thing to hear were the other diners and loud bartenders behind the bar.  I will say that their margarita was absolutely delicious..and I don't normally do margaritas.  I ordered a Dos XX Amber and Bobby got their Winter Pear marg.  It was honestly amazing!  We started with the $8 chips and salsa appetizer (I hate when places don't give complimentary chips and salsa but whatever) and the chips were fresh and crisp and all 3 salsas were very good, albeit being in 1/2 cup serving dishes.  I ordered the chicken fajitas for my meal and Bobby ordered the pork belly tacos.  The tacos were very different!!! They had a good texture, crisp but chewy and the meat was tender inside.  Not a whole lot of toppings.  It came with cilantro rice that had absolutely 0 flavor.  My chicken fajitas were basically a chicken breast sliced on top of a bed of onions and peppers.  Not much seasoning that I could tell.  There was sour cream, but no salsa (?.....seriously..?) and it came with beans and the flavorless rice.  Three corn tortillas were provided, but they were useless because they crumbled as soon as you tried to fold the fixings inside of them. I ended up just adding a ton of hot sauce and salsa from Bobby's plate to the chicken and peppers and eating them with my fork.  Really lacking the flavor in that dish.  I'd probably try tacos next time.  All in all, I think this place has really good potential - the interior is really neat and the bar is beautiful and from the small bit I have tried so far, they have good drinks.  Ambience and food need some work, though.

3jMRVvSjtDA7p_v42pNOrA.text: I went to Tres Rios last night with friends after hearing rave reviews. I LOVED IT! The atmosphere was trendy and the food & drinks were innovative. I ordered two margaritas- the Picante Paloma, which was made with grapefruit soda & jalapeno syrup, and the Roasted Red Pepper, which is made with the namesake's syrup and garnished with a salt & charred jalapeno rim. Both were SO delicious and I was shocked at how amazing the red pepper one was. Imagine a Bloody Mary but with a slight fresh pepper taste than tomato. The menu wasn't extremely extensive but there was something for everyone, no matter if you're adventurous or not. I ordered the Burrito Mojado with pato (duck) & it's covered in an ancho chile & cheese sauce. It was one of the best burritos I've ever had! The duck was so tender and had the best flavor. It was accompanied with a cilantro spring mix salad which was delicious as well! Will definitely be going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burrito Majado with the empty salad dish because I ate it in two bites!!
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted Red Pepper margarita

8WbfCvl2a38gdHJtAXS82Q.text: Love their authentic tacos and thirst quenching drinks. Finally somewhere to get great Mexican that puts Steel Cactus to shame! Would recommend to anyone any day! The margaritas are yummy and refreshing as well!

vzJIIdZc17XcLc6CUbnUfQ.text: Tres Rios is the best new restaurant in Pittsburgh! Cool atmosphere, impeccable service and amazing food and drinks! I really loved how the guacamole appetizer was separated into two even (and large) portions so I didn't have to fight over the last scoop with my boyfriend   they also have great drink specials! The rosemary margarita was delish- the perfect amount of sweet and salty, with a little bit of spice. Tres Rios will definitely become a regular spot for me! #3RMardiGras

OTsxO4P41lar6dmAvUIz6g.text: This place had a lot of promise, but quickly took a dive.  Everyone was so friendly when we came in, but the service was soooo slow.  Many of the tables were filled, but there were several waitresses.  A table of four was seated after us and they got their drinks before us and were almost done eating their main dish before we even got ours (we were just a table of 2).  We were never offered water and when we asked, we were done with our chips before we even got the water.  Atmosphere is cool, food was ok, drinks were watered down.  If they could improve their service, add more flavor to their food and improve the quality of drinks, it would be a nice little place.

MwwRiUEpn2JgTB7AqGZDeQ.text: Would not come back.   Drinks: I ordered the "Blast Furnace" margarita since I am a baby and only drink sweet low alcohol mixed drinks. Well this was delicious and sweet but had not a DROP of tequila in it, though it's supposed to be a tequila mixed drink... at a restaurant that calls itself a "tequila bar". BF had a beer and had no complaints.  Dining: We were not offered or given water, and we had a sit down meal at a booth! Only given a single flimsy paper napkin each, and this is a place that serves tacos which are obviously a bit messy to eat. My boyfriend liked the tacos but went through the sole napkin in 3 seconds. He did note that the lamb was a little tough. I got the yucca fries without chorizo (as this menu does not have a single vegetarian option...not even a vegetarian salad available, like wtf). The fries were served in a little bucket thing lined with paper. However these fries are drizzled with cheese sauce which immediately soaked through the paper lining and I spent the whole time trying not to eat shredded paper. Not to mention, there was practically no cheese sauce on it, which was a shame because it was the only flavorful part of the dish.   Overall okay flavors but poorly executed delivery. They need to get the basics down (give us water, napkins, and alcohol in our mixed drinks) before I'd ever come back.

ZHU6z8DVuX-TZCI__MqOsA.text: The food was just ok and the prices are a too high for a Mexican restaurant in the Southside.   For two of us to eat there it cost about $60 with tip. We did not order anything special or over the top. Chips and salsa costs $8 (salsa served in the same sized dishes as their condiments). House Margaritas are $10 each for an average size glass (weakly mixed). Fajitas were $14 and burritos were $12.   If you like a $10 weak drink, $8 cover charge (in the form of chips and salsa), and average food then this is the spot for you.

bLPVuiBShjurKbW4ZsvkvA.text: This place is great! It's open late and the food is great. It is clean and efficient. I didn't think I was feeling Mexican food, but as soon as I stepped into this restaurant I was craving Mexican food. Our waiter was very nice, too.

iWkYUKcLjEF7itBIdBNDSQ.text: This place is amazing!! It's my go to spot for real authentic Mexican food.. the guacamole is fire!!! The guacamole you will taste. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. The environment is real low key which I loved.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WLbMs9z8grr6boWaAGVjGQ.text: Excellent choice to go if you wantgreat food, drinks and atmosphere! We will definitely be back when we're in town again!

x41W10TROSUFGpb6hJYySg.text: First got interested in trying this place after sampling their entry in the south side soup contest. Their soup (corn truffle with toasted pumpkin seeds) was amazing!   I really liked it here! We started with the Yucca bowl which is a must try. Yucca are like fries that don't make you hate yourself after eating a giant serving of them. All of the toppings were generous and awesome and we probably could have filled up on this alone.   I'm glad a didn't though because the pork belly tacos were to die for! I especially loved the shell -- perfect mix of crunchy and chewy but stayed together. Obviously very fresh. The inside of the taco was really good too. The portion was just enough after the yucca bowl -- but might have left me wanting for more without and appetizer.   Also delicious were the drinks! I had the pomegranate jalepeno (i think) margarita and it was really unique and delicious. Perfect for sipping. BF on the other hand sucked down the winter pear margarita in about three seconds flat -- which is a little too quickly for a $10 drink in my opinion but he was paying so who am I to judge?

mk2UD0JKO7Sg0_-hzLp-Hg.text: Being from Texas our choices for Mexican food, or street tacos, are unlimited.  However, this place was absolutely a treat to my fiance and I.  Being skeptical at first we were pleasantly delighted when our carne asada tacos came out wrapped in a light, crisp homemade corn tortilla. My goodness were they delicious!! Not to mention the guacamole was just as good. Overall this place was awesome and the staff was great too. Highly recommend

I_p2JeTOc6OTTaLSZHvCWA.text: Hitting five stars was super easy. From start to ending of our meal we had a 5 star experience. Love the decor!!!  It's a little dark but has a light blue and orange pops of color. Looks like a combo of vintage meets contemporary. The hostesses were super friendly.  Our server came to the table and introduced himself. Again, super friendly. We started with the salsa sampler. It had tri-color corn chips and three types of salsa-pick, verde, and spicy. The chips and the salsa tasted fresh. A bit of salty ad spicy goodness.  I ordered the shrimp Tacos. The shells are very unique. They are made of corn yet they don't look like a typical corn taco shell. They are still very crispy but don't break into a thousand pieces when you bite into them. The shrimp was grilled nicely. It had a creamy slaw on top. It also came with a side of line and cilantro rice as well as verde salsa. The Tacos were full of flavor as they were but the salsa was a nice addition.  The duck was shredded and moist. It's hands down the best duck taco I have ever had. It had a bit of spice that wasn't overwhelming. It also came with the creamy slaw.  The rice was tasty but I am a lime fiend so I wish there had been a small line wedge to squeeze over it.  I like that the portions aren't huge (though you are getting 3 Tacos). I like that they are aiming for quality not quantity.  I thought the prices matched the level of food being served-duck was $11 and shrimp &13.  They have a side room big enough for a group. It would be a cool place to share dinner with a group of friends.  The manager stopped by the table which was nice.  All in all a 5 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Paris Tacos (duck Tacos)
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Tacos

KCZdGeWYYOQZJmADBilwWg.text: So far so good!  I really enjoyed the winter pear margarita.  The pescado (fish) tacos were AMAZING. Honestly I don't remember the last time I had one this good in Pittsburgh. The tortillas were handmade and overall the meal tasted fresh and was overall very satisfying. Only thing is I wish I had a bean option that automatically came with the meal-portions seemed a little small.  My boyfriend ordered the barbacoa burrito. It also was amazing!! I'm not sure if I like his or my food better!   I highly recommend checking this place out. I hope this restaurant maintains its quality food and service as it gains popularity.

GOciWzDtFriQf5wxUvVdAg.text: As both a huge taco person and a Southsider, I had high hopes for Tres Rios. The restaurant itself is quite large, and it's  divided into two sections. There's a large bar, and a seated area.   I stopped by a while ago back when the place first opened. I had duck tacos, which came in a set of three. I found the tacos quite small and dry.   I think at that point Tres Rios was still experimenting with the menu, so I'm not sure if something has changed. The presentation was great, and the food looked pretty, but the flavor/combination wasn't anything that particularly stuck out.  Tres Rios isn't bad by any means, but with all the other unique and established taco places on the street, Tres Rios will have to step it up and bring something different to the table.

2aJEEb4fmIdVpsAN7gXloQ.text: This guac is on fiiiiire. No, really, the guac is excellent. But who the hell charges $8 for chips and salsa at a Mexican restaurant? Everyone knows that's simply a reward for rolling the dice and walking through the door. If it wasn't for the excellent service and friendly manager checking on our table, I would have questioned my decision. Oddly enough, the drinks were unique and semi-affordable. Just can't comprehend how you can charge the same for an appy as you do for a main course. Gimme a happy hour & free chips/salsa and we'll talk. You can find me at the tequila bar all day, every day. SALUD.

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Holy shit, yucca fries! Never eating regular American taters again.
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guac, guac, guac, guac, guac. EVERYBODY.
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lime margarita on the rocks.

hws2Wq6ffHTANhKWvjP7fw.text: If you hate free chips and salsa, then this is the place for you. Really nice atmosphere and the spicy dragon fruit margarita is pretty good! Staff was nice. The food is just ok. If you're in the area, it's worth checking out but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

uVWhTBSVbEy4H6a4je2zZA.text: Great atmosphere. Very polite staff. Delicious food. Decent sized portions. Not too many "traditional" dishes, and the time felt a little long for an early Saturday with not too much going on, but those would be my only reason for not giving 5 stars. Our server was sure to check in on us every now and again and the staff was very kind. We ordered the chicken fajitas and chicken tacos which came in a very "hispter-style" serving tray. They both came with arroz verde and a few other things for you to piece together your meal with to your liking.  I know that's not my favorite restaurant trend in the world, personally, but it definitely wouldn't take away from your experience.

Vhv9kZ9lGKrpl0UqMe0CXw.text: What a pleasant surprise! Came here when a few other go to places in south side were packed. It's not the cheapest food but the ambiance is nice. Basically the menu consists of tacos, which come in orders of 3 for $11-14ish. That seems like a fair price when compared to the other fancy taco places. I do wish they would let you either buy tacos individually or mix and match. My table ended up doing some crazy swapping so we could try the various meats. Think the consensus was the carne asada and carnitas were the favorite. We also tried the duck and the pork belly. The tortilla is amazing. I didn't try any of the margaritas this time but they looked good. Hope they come up with a happy hour, because it's still hard to justify some of the crazy taco prices that have seemed to pop up in the burgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Duck tacos

Z7NzoGwnyhN2PeOnR4UPPA.text: The fish tacos were fantastic, house made corn tortillas, yum! I really enjoyed the cilantro rice and salsa verde that accompanied them, bartender was very personable.

Xtx_YPYyl2MA4N9-fJ2Gyg.text: Hands down, the best margarita I have ever had is the seasonal winter pear.  It's like Christmas and freshly fallen snow and ice skaters and a roaring fire all wrapped up in a glass with tequila.  It's a must.    Turns out, the food is pretty darn good as well.  I had the Mexicuban - which is a Mexican take on the classic Cuban sandwich and it was delicioso!  Great bread, which makes or breaks a Cuban, awesome meats and a side of chips and their amazing roasted tomato salsa.

TpOy1e2ffWem8jJBXh25xA.text: Good authentic Mexican food definitely good for lunch or dinner the guacamole is delicious and the margaritas are just strong enough. Me and my fiance Really enjoyed our Time dining at this restaurant we will certainly be coming here again. The service was great and staff very friendly.

QWYNKTTQeaDEJED80YwZRQ.text: Went here over the weekend and had the best service I have had in Pittsburgh.  The food is largely what you would expect- a Pittsburgh versioning of Tex mex.  I had the pulled pork burrito and it was Pretty good.

VqRI1QGCk3l1EW34A8vHBg.text: I have been to this restaurant twice now. It's authenitic and trendy. The staff is super friendly and accommodating especially our favorite waitress Sandra! The food is delicious and with hand crafted elements like the yummy tortillas. Delicious drinks too!

Tv1sPL2gFiwNln6_f9qyfA.text: There are so many taco places opening up in Pittsburgh and if you want to be on top you have to step up your game Tres Rios.  We went on a Friday night and were seated right away by a friendly host. Our waitress was great and the food and drinks came out very quickly.  The  happy hour special was pretty disappointing and the house margaritas were $6. I don't really call that a special but we ordered two and they were very tasty.  Another thing that they really need to do is give out free chips and salsa or for a very minimum price ($2-$4).  The only option was an appetizer of 3 salsas with chips for $8.  We really didn't want to pay for all of that but I am glad we tried out their 3 salsas which were mediocre.  For my entree I went with the chicken tacos.  They do not come with cheese and I had to pay an extra $1 to get cheese on my tacos which I was not very pleased about. The portions are great and the presentation of the entrees is excellent.  My 3 tacos were served with a side of salsa and green rice.  The taco shells were different. What I liked is that they were sturdy and did not fall apart and also very fresh. What I didn't  like was they were greasy.  My husband ordered a burrito which was served with a side salad. He was very pleased with his choice and the salad had a nice light, lime dressing.

e5FP4jVKTk6kYPhG6UYfaA.text: Food and drinks were amazing!!! Great customer service as well. Highly recommend!! I had a delicious chicken burrito and my husband had the duck tacos. The fresh guacamole had just the right taste!

photos.caption: Photo of Tres Rios - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

eQ07sqPM1x67kaikc9wF-g.text: My friend was in town for a visit and we spent our Saturday night bar hopping on Carson Street. The best stop of the night was Tres Rios! We ordered a side of yucca fries and their version of Street corn. To drink, I had a peach margarita- which was amazing! The bartender was very friendly and made great conversation with us at the beginning of our visit. It was strange that for a Saturday night, there would only be one person responsible for the drinks. She was trying to service the bar and make the drinks for the guests seated at the tables. Several servers would come over and just stare at her and wait for their orders. There was gentleman that seemed to be a manager of sorts, but he didn't help her with the drink orders when they backed up. Because of this, our service at the bar suffered. In the end, the food we ate was delicious and the drinks were amazing. I'll definitely be back with the intention of eating a full meal and spending more time. The decor is also fun!

YxH7LvAkmHUqjOxAWJMBnQ.text: My friend wanted to try this place and I didn't want to because I live in California and have a lot of really good choices for Mexican food. I have to admit that Our tacos were really good. My friend thinks the black beans were the best She ever had. My daughter and I enjoyed the yucca fries. The reason I decided to write this review after reading the review about someone complaining about cilantro in "cilantro rice"- THEN DON'T ORDER IT if U don't like cilantro! People are so picky. I will admit that My friend and I did not like Our drinks ordered from the specials menu. Hers was really bad- with passion fruit and mine was fine with food. The Paloma. Maybe some people like jalapeno syrup in their drinks but I should have just ordered a regular margarita . The waitress was really nice and the bartender did make My friend another drink ( plain margarita ) that was very good. I didn't want to also complain about My drink but it was not a good Paloma. Leaving 4 stars cuz the food was good, service was great and I would come back again when I am in town to try some other items.
